snippet: In an era when the United States has been focused on new forms of conflict, the dangerous contest suddenly erupting in the East China Sea seems almost like a throwback to the Cold War.
abstract: News analysis; thorny dispute over islands in the East China Sea has raised fears of escalating conflict and complicated the Obama administration's plan to manage China's rise without overtly trying to contain it; once-obscure disagreement has led to deployment of military assets in region by both sides, recalling proxy confrontations that were hallmark of the Cold War.

byline.contributor: Jane Perlez contributed reporting from Beijing, and Martin Fackler from Tokyo.

lead_paragraph: In an era when the United States has been focused on new forms of conflict, the dangerous contest suddenly erupting in the East China Sea seems almost like a throwback to the Cold War.

headline.main: In the East China Sea, a Far Bigger Test of Power Looms
headline.print_headline: In the East China Sea, a Far Bigger Test of Power Looms
